intro: Metrosideros bartlettii, commonly known as the Bartlett's Christmas Bush, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtle family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its bright red flowers that bloom during the holiday season. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces distinctive, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky slopes or cliffs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
